column4: Guess I'm the one asking the question this time :) I was trying to install vista. Booted into ubuntu live cd and resized my ext3 partition. Problem is that vista install does see the reserved space and apparently is able to create a 'new' partition in that space, but it can't find 'a partition suitable for installation' for some reason. I'm now trying to create an ntfs partition from ubuntu, but gparted cant make ntfs partition.. MY QUESTI
VIsta wastes your psyical hard disk
can't resize VIsta to a good size  without risking dataloss
yeah GParted won't do vista's partition properly,  and the vista resizing itself stuff is not that good either
if you got enough RAM, you can  virtual machine Vista  or  XP
fine for everything pretty much, but not 3D games
the problem is that I need to develop C# XNA apps for my job, which is very buggy (very early 3d acceleration support) in VM's
well you can put Vista, on  and save to the partition from Ubuntu anyway
indeed, however when the channel is dead arguing as you called it, well made it at least more active :D
also isn't that really the point of this channal, to hopefuly get fast help?
or to be giving that help
Good for the channel, bad for my self-esteem! :D
